You Are Not So Smart: Why You Have Too Many Friends on Facebook, Why Your Memory Is Mostly Fiction, and 46 Other Ways You're Deluding Yourself

‚úçÔ∏è David McRaney

Tags: David McRaney, lang-en

This book is from the You Are Not S√≥ Smart podcast host. It consists of short chapters each one addressing a specific cognitive bias.

The good: great variety of biases, several studies are cited (of course we should read them with a grain of salt) and the book has a rich reference section for each of the biases.

The not so good: the author can be a little bit condescending to the reader and has an black-or-white take on some of the biases. The world is in grayscale and I believe he could have been more nuanced.
